results.title: Mindscape
results.creator_credit: Jacques Drouin, Gaston Sarault and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A particularly creative example of the pinscreen animation technique, this film is about an artist who steps inside his painting and wanders about in a landscape peopled with symbols that trigger unexpected associations. Film without words. (Eighteen awards including Ottawa; Yorkton; Columbus; New York; Los Angeles)

results.title: Mind your back
results.creator_credit: Bruce Bennett, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The proper method of lifting heavy loads in coal mines. Demonstrates correct and incorrect methods in a variety of circumstrances, including raising, carrying and lowering a load; lifting, pushing and pulling a prop; lifting a gas cylinder, bag of cement, and 44 gallon drum; and team lifting.

results.title: Mimi: an evening with Aboriginal Islander Dance Theatre
results.creator_credit: Andee Reese, Margaret Anne Smith, Reese/Smith Productions and Smith Productions
results.brief_description: Students from the Aboriginal Islander Dance Theatre perform several of their dance pieces which demonstrate their ability to perform modern dance as well as more traditional dance forms, with, at times, an innovative blending of the two.

results.title: Mime over matter
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel, Kratky Film and Sim Productions
results.brief_description: Examines the use of pantomime to explore ideas and provoke open-ended discussion of such topics as man’s relationship to the material objects that make his life comfortable. Features Ladislav Fialka and his Prague Pantomime.

results.title: MIMA Yearbook. Vol. 3
results.brief_description: Volume three of a three volume set, this video compilation of excerpts of Australian film and video art covers the period from 1983-1986, and is a unique and tantalising entry into the non-mainstream history of Australian film and video.

results.title: Millhouse: a white comedy
results.creator_credit: Emile de Antonio and White Film Company
results.brief_description: Newsreel and television footage is used to satirise the political career of Richard Millhouse Nixon. The film landed de Antonio on the director on Nixon’s infamous enemy list.

results.title: Millenium Dilemma: Constitutional Change in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jane Innes and University of Wollongong
results.brief_description: A five part series which analyses the Australian Constitution and its prospects for change in the 21st century. The programs discuss a variety of issues related to the Australian constitution, with each focusing on specific subjects that define the content of the interviews with and commentary from politicians, academics, media commentators and legal counsel that make up each episode. The subjects covered by the series include the history of the Australian Constitution and its founding ideals, the possible make up of an Australian Republic and the necessary adaptations to the Constitution, the Australian Parliament and the Executive as well as their distribution of powers, the rights and guarantees contained in the Constitution for the community, issues of aboriginal reconciliation in the Constitution and the future of the Constitution through the political channels for change such as referendums.

results.title: Milk: from farm to you. - 3rd ed.
results.creator_credit: James Kennedy, Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Follows the complete cycle of milk production, including the necessity of conception and calving. Explains homogenisation and pasteurisation, and depicts the production of related dairy products such as cheese and icecream. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Milk for South East Asia
results.brief_description: The most suitable dairy products for exporting to South-East Asia are anhydrous milk fat or butter oil and skimmed milk powder - neither require refrigeration. They are separated from milk in Australia and recombined with water and sugar in modern factories in Djakarta or other South-East Asian countries. 16,000 tons of milk fat and 50,000 tons of skimmed milk powder are exported each year to supplement the protein diet of people in these countries.

results.title: Milk at its best
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson and Michael Robertson Film Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how advances in technology have brought about a major change in the production and marketing of milk in the past few years. Notes the use of fully automated systems in dairies which ensure maximum efficiency and cleanliness, and how further tests are carried out in laboratories before packaging or bottling. All aspects of milk production are supervised by the Dairy Industry Marketing Authority which exercises strict control over hygiene. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
